content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': "This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs a system, I received a command to execute the 'curl' command to search for news articles about the US economy. The 'execute_shell' command did not work as expected, so I suggested using the 'curl' command to search for articles about the US economy on a search engine instead. The 'curl' command returned a list of URLs, which I provided to you. You then requested me to browse the BBC news website for the current state of the US economy, but the text summary command returned that the text did not provide any information about the US economy. You then asked me to browse the New York Times website for the latest news articles about the US economy, but the website did not have any relevant articles. I suggested using the 'pup' command to search for articles, but it was not installed on the system. I suggested using the 'apt-get' command to install it, and it was successful."}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'your computer', 'content': 'Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text does not provide information on the current state of the US economy. It contains various news articles and sections covering different topics. However, it does mention that the US labor market added 253,000 jobs in April despite the banking crisis, but economic growth has slowed as firms cut investment and the US raised interest rates to the highest in 16 years. \n \n Links: ["Find out what\'s changed (https://www.bbc.com/usingthebbc/your-data-matters)", \'cookies (https://www.bbc.com/usingthebbc/cookies/what-do-i-need-to-know-about-cookies/)\', \'cookies (https://www.bbc.com/usingthebbc/cookies/what-do-i-need-to-know-about-cookies/)\', \'\\nNo, take me to settings\\nNo, take me to settings\\n (https://www.bbc.com/usingthebbc/cookies/how-can-i-change-my-bbc-cookie-settings/)\', \'Homepage (https://www.bbc.com)\']'}, {'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "curl -s \'https://www.google.com/search?q=us+economy+news&rlz=1C1GCEU_enUS832US832&oq=us+economy+news&aqs=chrome.0.69i59l2j0i22i30l4.1322j1j7&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8\' | pup \'a attr{href}\' | grep -E \'^http\' | head -n 1"}}}'}]
"""
